sentences: Martijn Gerard Garritsen (Dutch: [mɑrˈtɛin ɣəˈrɑrt ˈxɑrɪtsə(n)]; born 14 May 1996), known professionally as Martin Garrix, is a Dutch disc jockey who was ranked number one on DJ Mag's Top 100 DJs list for three consecutive years—2016, 2017, and 2018.
section: N/A

sentences: His most known singles are "Animals", "In the Name of Love" and "Scared to Be Lonely".
section: N/A

sentences: He is also known by his pseudonyms "Ytram" and "GRX".
section: N/A

sentences: He has performed at music festivals such as Coachella, Electric Daisy Carnival, Ultra Music Festival, Tomorrowland, and Creamfields.
section: N/A

sentences: In 2014 he headlined the 1st edition of Ultra South Africa making this his first major festival.
section: N/A

sentences: In the same year he became the youngest DJ to headline 2014 Ultra Music Festival at the age of 17.
section: N/A

sentences: He was a resident DJ at Spain's Hï Ibiza (2017) and Ushuaïa Ibiza (2016 and 2018).
section: N/A

sentences: He founded the label Stmpd Rcrds in 2016, months after leaving Spinnin' Records and before signing with Sony Music.
section: N/A
== Early life ==

sentences: Early life ==
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Garrix was born as Martijn Gerard Garritsen on 14 May 1996 in Amstelveen in the Netherlands, the son of Gerard and Karin Garritsen.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: He has a younger sister named Laura.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: He showed musical interest at an early age and learned to play the guitar at the age of 8.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: In 2004, he expressed interest in becoming a DJ after seeing Dutch DJ Tiësto perform at that year's Summer Olympics Opening Ceremony in Athens.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: He took particular inspiration from the track "Traffic", prompting him to download the specialist digital audio workstation FL Studio, enabling him to start producing.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: In 2013, he graduated from the Herman Brood Academy, a production school in Utrecht.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: The next month, he announced on his Instagram account he have ended up his relationship for over three years with Dutch model Charelle Schriek.
section: == Career == | === 2019: Headlining festivals & song leaks ===

sentences: On 24 December 2019, Spinnin' Records won the appeal from the court ruling of the Higher Court of Leeuwarden, suggesting that Garrix did not have the right to break his agreement prematurely with Spinnin' and MusicAllstars Management.
section: == Career == | === 2019: Headlining festivals & song leaks ===

sentences: A few days after Spinnin' Records won the appeal, Martin's computer was hacked by an unknown assailant where the hacker stole and leaked a handful of unreleased music including "Rewind, Repeat It".
section: == Career == | === 2019: Headlining festivals & song leaks ===

sentences: For the 2020 King's Day celebrations in April, Garrix played a set from the rooftop of A'Dam tower in Amsterdam in place of the usual in-person festivities due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

sentences: The next month, he released the single "Higher Ground", featuring singer John Martin.
section: == Career == | === 2020–present: New collaborations ===

sentences: On 5 February 2021, Garrix released the single "Pressure", featuring Swedish singer Tove Lo.
section: == Career == | === 2020–present: New collaborations ===

sentences: On his 25th Birthday, 14 May 2021, Garrix released a new track called "We Are The People" featuring Bono and the Edge from Irish rock band U2 that served as the official song for UEFA Euro 2020.
section: == Career == | === 2020–present: New collaborations ===

sentences: The trio performed the song as part of the tournament's virtual opening ceremony at Rome's Stadio Olimpico, Garrix also performed the song as part of a DJ mix for the competitions closing ceremony during the final at London's Wembley Stadium.

sentences: Brand endorsement and modelling ==

sentences: The announcement was made in October 2015.

sentences: In 2017, Garrix was an ambassador for Italian brand Armani Exchange's "Fall Winter 2017" campaign.

sentences: The announcement was made in July 2017, along with the release of the promotional photographs on social media.
section: == Brand endorsement and modelling ==

sentences: The promotional video, featuring Garrix wearing the brand's clothing and eyewear line, was released in August 2017.
section: == Brand endorsement and modelling ==

sentences: In 2018, Garrix was once again an ambassador for Armani Exchange.
section: == Brand endorsement and modelling ==

sentences: The promotional video for the brand's "Fall Winter 2018" campaign was released in August 2018, featuring Garrix wearing the brand's new clothing line.
section: == Brand endorsement and modelling ==

sentences: His collaboration track with Loopers, "Game Over", was used for the video.
section: == Brand endorsement and modelling ==

sentences: The behind-the-scenes footage during the filming was also released by Armani Exchange.
section: == Brand endorsement and modelling ==

sentences: Garrix became an ambassador for AXE, launched a limited-edition Martin Garrix body spray, which was launching on 14 September 2018.

== Philanthropy ==

sentences: Philanthropy ==
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: In May 2016, Garrix headlined an event in Los Angeles with all proceeds going to the non-profit organisation Fuck Cancer, dedicated to early detection, prevention and providing support to those affected by cancer.
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: In November 2016, Garrix started his India tour with a special charity show in Mumbai with over 62,000 in attendance.
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: Hosted at the Mahalaxmi Racecourse, the charity event's purpose was to educate Indian children, with the proceeds from the show being donated to Magic Bus, who will be supporting the education of 10,000 children across the country.
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: On 24 February 2017, Garrix was announced as an "international friend" for SOS Children's Village in South Africa, a non-profit organisation that "builds families for orphaned, abandoned, and other vulnerable children around the world".
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: Speaking to Billboard, he said "it is awful that so many children around the world don't have the support of a caring family".
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: Following the Mexico earthquake in 2017, Garrix donated $10,000 of his fee as Ultra Mexico line up.
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: On 28 February 2019, Garrix visited the SOS Children's Village in South Africa while on tour for Ultra South Africa.
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: During his visit Garrix performed a one-hour DJ set to an excited crowd of 100 children and young people, some aged just three years old and accompanied by their SOS mothers.
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: In September 2019, Garrix held a show in his home country the Netherlands with all proceeds going towards the War Child Holland Charity.
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: During the show he raised more than €270,000.
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: In June 2020, he appeared in a public service announcement alongside other celebrities for War Child, an organisation that supports and empowers the most vulnerable communities, focusing on children and their families.
section: == Philanthropy ==
